result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifford L. Gilbert Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Clifford L. Gilbert in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi appeared.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Clifford L. Gilbert Jr.
Current: 3747 W. Route 64 lot 86, Mount Morris, IL 61054 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2015)
Prior: 236 Walworth Street #4, Sharon, WI 53585
Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi appeared.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH A.P. OR J.M. (DOB 04-01-2009).  If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney M. Nepomiachi for bond purposes only. Tracy Mcmiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
